content: dear rpkemorrell, if you have forgot your password you can visit this website https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password#w_reset-your-primary-password-if-you-have-forgotten-it

content: are you talking about a thunderbird primary password see https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password#w_reset-your-primary-password-if-you-have-forgotten-it, or the password for your mail account. If it is the later you need to contact your mail provider.

content: The password that Thunderbird has is likely wrong, as it apparently isn't working. You can see that at settings>privacy&security. Otherwise, to reset your password you need to contact your email provider.
creator: davidsk

content: I regret you are having difficulties. If you will share the complete text of any error messages that will help. Also, a screenshot, if possible, of your SMTP server settings pane will help in seeing what your settngs are.
creator: davidsk

content: The error indicates the authentication method on the account is 'normal password'. It must be OAuth2 for gmail and hotmail accounts, for the incoming and outgoing.
creator: sfhowes

content: Account Settings, Server Settings, for the incoming, and Outgoing Server (SMTP), bottom of Account Settings left pane.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Hernan Fonda said
Good afternoon, I have two accounts set up through Thunderbird, hfonda@moscuzza.com and buques@moscuzza.com I read both on my notebook and on my mobile phone, but they are not synchronised. In other words, if, for example, I create a subfolder on my computer, I cannot see it on my phone, and vice versa. Is it possible to synchronise the account on all devices? Thank you very much. I look forward to your reply. Kind regards, Hernan Fonda

If the accounts are set up as POP, synchronization is not possible - they must be IMAP on all devices.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Convert_a_POP_account_to_a_IMAP_account
creator: sfhowes

content: The challenge is that the profile was not designed for this; it gets updated when Thunderbird is updated. There is a compatibility.ini file in the profile you could delete after each update and then let Thunderbird do it, but that isn't really better.
creator: davidsk
